intro.description: The following steps show how to locate ProcessVariables in the archive and add them to a plot.

item.title: Open the Data Browser Perspective
item.description:
The Data Browser Perspective offers a pre-arranged layout of the Archive View, Data Browser Configuration panel etc.
Select Window->Open Perspective->Data Browser in the menu bar at the top of the workbench to access it.
If there is no Data Browser entry, use "Other.." and select it from there.

item.title: Reset the Perspective
item.description:
You should now see a "Data Browser Archives" View to the left.
If not, reset the prespective to its original state by right-clicking on the "Data Browser" perspective tab and selecting "Reset".

item.title: Select Archive Server
item.description:
Select an archive data server URL from the drop-down list on top of the "Data Browser Archives" View.
One or more archives should appear. Select the ones that you want to query.

item.title: Locate Process Variables
item.description:
Enter a process variable name "Pattern" and press "Search".
To learn more about the available search patterns, refer to the online help via the (?) button above.

item.title: Send PVs to new Data Browser
item.description: Select one or more PVs, right-click, select CSS->Data Browser to start a new Data Browser instance for these PVs.

item.title: Add PVs to existing Data Browser plot
item.description:
Select one or more PVs, drag them into an existing Data Browser plot.
When dropping them on the main area of the plot, each dropped PV will default to a new axis, which can be adjusted in the Data Browser Config View.
When dropping them onto an existing Y-axis of the plot, the dropped PVs will default to that axis, which can again be modified in the Data Browser Config View.
